body.p: includes a built-in mechanism for restricting connections to untrusted hosts and code locations. There is a Security page in the that provides options for handling security-related features, including an option for specifying trusted code locations and a firewall option where you can choose to restrict access to hosts that are not specified as being trusted.

section.title: Trusted Code
section.p: By default, Web Author does not load code (such as CSS or Schematron) referenced directly in documents unless it comes from the framework (document type association). However, you can specify code locations to be considered trusted by adding them in the Trusted Code option in the Security section of the . The code locations need to be declared with URL patterns, one per line. For example:https://www.example.com/doc/help.php?product-webauthor&pageId=my_topic *example.css

section.title: Trusted Hosts
section.p: It is possible to restrict the hosts that the Web Author server is allowed to connect to. The Security page in the includes a Firewall option where you can choose to allow all connections or only allow connections to hosts that you specify as trusted. You can specify the hosts to be considered trusted by adding them (one per line) in the Only allow connections to these trusted hosts option in the Security section of the . For example:devel-new.example.com:8089 localhost:8081
section.note: Plugins can specify whether a connection is allowed or denied, regardless of whether or not they are listed in the Security page.
